body: I have run updateAllUObjects to synch with GitHUB to get the latest version of Ladybug - can someone help me locate the Ground Temp component. Thx.
topic: Location of the Ladybug Ground Temp Component

replies.body:
Look for group 2 | Visualize Weather Data, under LB tab.

-A.

Thanks Abraham. Chris, in case you don't know, you can also double click and type name of component. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/EZUt9tlUyQlCianOBzvcRzXiBel9x89U6UYs6oiU71cbLAg37DEE9S98sBr-aOKAa1popn6JrcvHP1NaljBsp8xLzXK-prhM/search.jpg)

Hi Mostapha, May I ask how to customize the "Site:GroundTemperature:BuildingSurface" IDF object in Honeybee? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/rYXJV*jyRSkDxV1QcwoavAOnBcwKsBHEjxfGKfUfGei*W7aOy5tYUIXgjS0dU67xh3wHHHTS1mQrUS7mwd8DGpbsNEeep6Ai/Capture.PNG)

Hi Grasshope,



I would open new issues for questions like this. Check this link for an example: [http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/problem-set...](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/problem-setting-energy-plus-fields-in-honeybee?commentId=2985220%3AComment%3A1260955&groupId=2985220%3AGroup%3A658987)



Mostapha

Thanks for getting this one, Mostapha.  Yes, you should use the ground temperature input on the EnergySimPar.  I haven't yet implemented the capability to calculate these 12 temperatures the way that E+ suggests you to do (with the CalcSoilSurfTemp exe in the PreProcess folder in E+).  However, if you know you what your ground temperatures should be, you can input them here.

-Chris
